Wendell Bailey]] | birth_date ={{Birth date|1925|6|27}} | birth_place = [[Licking, Missouri|Licking]], [[Missouri]] | death_date={{dda|1992|12|25|1926|6|27}} | death_place=[[Houston, Missouri]] | party = [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] | term_start = January 3, 1961 | term_end = January 3, 1981 | resting_place = | alma_mater = [[University of Missouri]] | profession = }} '''Richard Howard Ichord Jr.''' ('''Dick''') (June 27, 1926 – December 25, 1992) was a significant [[United States of America|U.S.]] [[anti-Communist]] political figure. A member of the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]], he served as the last chairman of the [[House Un-American Activities Committee]] between 1969 and 1975 (called the [[House Internal Security Committee]] since 1969). Ichord was born in [[Licking, Missouri|Licking]], [[Missouri]]. From 1944 to 1946 he served in the [[United States Navy]]. He attended the [[University of Missouri]] in [[Columbia, Missouri|Columbia]], receiving a [[Bachelor of Science]] degree in 1949, and a [[Juris Doctor]] in 1952. He afterwards worked as a lawyer in private practice. From 1952 to 1960 he was a member of the [[Missouri House of Representatives|Missouri State House of Representatives]], where he served as [[Speaker (politics)|Speaker]] [[Pro Tempore]] in 1957, and Speaker in 1959. Elected as the [[United States House of Representatives|U.S. Representative]] for Missouri's [[List of United States Congressional districts#Missouri|8th District]] in 1960, he was re-elected nine times, serving in the [[Eighty-seventh United States Congress|Eighty-seventh]] through [[Ninety-sixth United States Congress|Ninety-sixth]] Congresses (1961–1980). In addition to the House Un-American Activities Committee, he also served on the [[House Armed Services Committee]]. He did not run for reelection in 1980. After his retirement from office, Ichord became a professional advocate in Missouri and served as co-chairman of [[American Freedom Coalition]] with Congressman [[Bob Wilson (US politician)|Bob Wilson]]. He was living in the city of [[Houston, Missouri]] at the time of his death. He co-authored the book ''Behind Every Bush: Treason or Patriotism'' (1979) with [[John Boyd (author)|Boyd Upchurch]]. ==References== * "[http://bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=I000001 ICHORD, Richard Howard, II, (1926 - 1992)]", ''[[Biographical Directory of the United States Congress|Congressional Biographical Directory of the United States 1774–Present]]''.
